title: Customer Business Analyst
description:
Company Description

We take care of our employees, and they take care of our customers!

Become a member of a global community! The international logistics industry is an integral piece of the global trade puzzle; we make the world go round. Global supply chain management is what we do, and at the heart of Expeditors you will find professionalism, leadership, and a friendly environment, all of which foster an innovative, customer service-based approach to logistics.Expeditors is a global logistics company headquartered in Seattle, Washington.As a Fortune 500 company, we employ over 19,000 trained professionals in a worldwide network of over 350+ locations across six continents. Expeditors satisfies the increasingly sophisticated needs of international trade through customized solutions and seamless, integrated information systems.

Our Mission

We recruit, train, and retain the very best logistics and technical experts the world over.We love to promote from within— more than 50 percent of our employees have been at Expeditors for five years or more. Our high retention rate is influenced by a unique compensation program for positions that are more than just jobs — they’re chances to grow, do what you love and build a career with us!

Job Description

SUMMARY DESCRIPTION

Expeditors’ is seeking a curious and self-motivated business intelligence analyst to execute on our technical roadmap and build scalable, sustainable data solutions. This role will support the Account Management department and Expeditors’ largest Global Accounts by sourcing and shaping data to bring our stakeholders’ visions to reality.


Communication
Partner closely with Account Managers and understand their needs in order to build intelligent data solutions.
Demonstrate solutions in a customer-facing environment.
Effectively bridge the gap between technical and non-technical users.
Intake project requests and grasp both the big picture and fine details.
Maintain project list and successfully convey status, timelines, priorities, and future projects.
Collaborate with the team to deliver best practice sharing and ongoing improvements.
Deliver excellent customer service.
Expeditors Business Acumen
Build knowledge of the logistics industry and Expeditors' specific business.
Build relationships with various stakeholders across departments.
Analytical Mindset
Understand stakeholder’s business needs and processes and translate them into requirements for data solutions to help provide insights for customers.
Ability to use logic to problem solve and troubleshoot and clearly relay issues to stakeholders.
Ensure data quality and data integrity.
Keep up with new and emerging tools.
Write SQL to source data from Expeditors’ data warehouse.
Use business intelligence tools to:
Combine data from multiple sources
Transform the structure of data to meet business needs.
Build formulas and measures for calculations.
Visualize data to tell effective data stories and unlock actionable insights.


Qualifications

Qualifications


Required Skills and Attributes
Bachelor’s degree required
Minimum 5 to 10 Years
Effective communication and interpersonal skills – ability to relate to employees at all levels
Strong analytical skills
Strong technical skills (Advanced Excel, Power BI)
Ability to design creative solutions to meet business needs
Desired Skill-Sets and Characteristics
4 Year degree in a quantitative field, business, or similar concentration
Proficient in SQL, preferred but not necessary
Experience with data visualization tool (Power BI or Tableau)
Comfortable presenting data to non-data users

Additional Information

Additional Information


Constantly improve knowledge of Expeditors’ operational procedures, systems, and technologies.
Maintain a minimum of 52 hours of training annually with a focus on systems training and operations.
Cross-training on other areas of personal development.
Personal goals communicated to gain support from leadership.


REPORTING STRUCTURE


Senior Manager, IS Global Service Center
